item.title: Remembering the Thunderbird Hotel and Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Strip Icon
item.description:
A Southwestern Oasis on the Strip

The Las Vegas Strip wasn’t always the glittering behemoth it is today. Back in 1948, it was a burgeoning stretch of Highway 91, and the Thunderbird Hotel and Casino was a vital piece of that early, pioneering landscape. Opened on September 2nd, 1948, it stood as the fourth resort on the burgeoning Strip, a significant milestone in Las Vegas’s evolution from a desert outpost to a gambling and entertainment hub. It wasn’t initially called the Thunderbird, however! The project, announced in March 1946, started life as the “Nevada Ambassador.”
